programme.title: Spartak Moscow Football Disaster
programme.short_synopsis: A crush at a football stadium is covered up by the Soviet state.
programme.medium_synopsis:
A crush at Spartak football stadium, Moscow, is covered up by the Soviet state.
Witness hears from two men who were there that day in 1982.
programme.long_synopsis:
In communist era Russia, several hundred people died in a crush at Spartak football stadium in Moscow. 

The true number of deaths at the football match was never revealed because of a cover-up of the disaster by the Soviet state, the USSR. 

We hear from two men who were in the stadium on the day of the tragedy in 1982.

programme.title: Witness
programme.short_synopsis: The story of our times told by the people who were there

supporting_content_items.title: Witness: Did you see the Berlin Wall being built?
supporting_content_items.content: Witness is looking for someone who saw the building of the Berlin Wall. Were you there? Email mybbc@bbc.co.uk
